result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Dean O'Shogay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called.
Defendant Darrell Dean O'Shogay in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
Factual basis exists based on record.
DEF: pleads no contest.
Court: accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.
ADA Marcoux: gives argument for sentence
Atty Yohnke: concurs with ADA Marcoux's statement, DEF is prepared to accept consequences and argues for recommendation.
DEF: nothing to add
Court addresses DEF.
Court will follow joint recomendation. $100.00 fine plus costs. Total $ 579.00, 60 days to pay or set up payment plan.
